page.title: 09Foxhunting in West Lothian
page.content: The Linlithgow and Stirlingshire Hunt meets twice a year in Torphichen, in December and March. Thre are between seventy and eighty members altogether and about thirty five are young people. Lots of people follow the hunt and there are sometimes protesters but there has not been too much trouble from saboteurs. West Lothian District Council has recently brought out a new ruling that the hunt can not ride across their land after the fox. This causes problems for the hunt because the hounds have on several occasions entered the council's land and the hunt had dificulties in retreiving the hounds.
